parameters: \pop[2]We head right to Isaac's work after our brief trip to the plane.
\pop[2]It was kind of odd to say goodbye to that place. It was supposed to be our HQ.
\pop[2]But I guess our homes are safer. Even if they aren't anywhere near as cool.
\pop[2]The store is big, so we can all spread out yet remain close together.
\pop[2]Everyone's essentials are packed into a bag they're carrying with them.
\pop[2]But it's inconspicuous. Messenger bags, laptop bags, Dante's laptop bag...
\pop[2]It's weird how that's all Dante brought with him.
\pop[2]But I guess everyone has a different take on the word "essential".
\pop[2]He could easily keep himself occupied for Isaac's shift, though.
\pop[2]Good thing it was a short one today. Only around four hours.
\pop[2]Apparently, his time-off request was approved for the convention, too.
\pop[2]I'd ask about New Year's Eve, but I assume he has it off by default.
We have dead days here and there, but this is \c[14]awful\c[0].
At least we can just hang out and chat with each other.
\pop[4]Because there's \c[14]so\c[0] much fun stuff to talk about right now...
\pop[3]Hey, we have the New Year's Eve party.
It'll help get our mind off of everything.
\pop[3]\c[14]Should\c[0] we be getting our minds off things, though?
I'd say that's almost like letting our guard down.
Even at the party, I bet I'll be freaking out.
Before you know it, we could all end up dead.
\pop[3]With stretches like that, you should be teaching yoga.
We're gonna be fiiiiiine. Don't let this sabotage our fun.
And just so you know, I \c[14]am\c[0] pretty flexible.
Back to our regularly scheduled Taylor.
\pop[4]So what exactly happens on New Year's Eve?
I know about the whole "four midnights" thing, but what else?
\pop[3]Are we gonna play the "leave it behind" game?
\pop[3]Well, you get to do something you might regret.
Confess something, like your feelings, or do something risky...
\pop[3]If it ends up going well, then everything is fine.
But if not, then you get to "leave it behind" when you enter the new year.
\pop[4]Sounds like you just want to escape consequences.
\pop[4]I think we're all getting pretty good at that.
Speaking of which, we need to stock up on snacks.
\pop[3]Wanna go pick some up for us?
The connected store has everything, and we can still keep an eye on you.
\pop[4]Sure, but we'll need to make a list.
\pop[4]I feel like letting loose at the party.
I'll probably just eat everything in sight.
Aren't you supposed to watch your diet?
\pop[2]Before the conversation continues, his phone rings.
I kinda have to get this one.
Not like we have much else to do.
\pop[2]He picks up his phone and walks out of earshot.
\pop[2]Suddenly, I think of what Kyron told me on the plane.
\pop[2]I wonder who he's talking to, and what he's telling them.
\pop[2]The fact that he keeps glancing back at us isn't helping.
\pop[2]Everyone seems to be taking important calls these days.
\pop[2]First my counselor, and now Klace? Interesting...
\pop[2]Before he can finish, all the TV's in the store go black in unison.
\pop[2]Then, static appears, the sound almost assaulting our ears.
\pop[2]Soon, the sound dies down, leaving just the view of static.
\pop[2]We all look at each other, confused.
\pop[2]I see Klace hang up his phone, and walk back to the group.
Hold on, I'll take a closer look.
\pop[2]He goes to his computer, and starts typing away.
\pop[2]But almost a second later, the source of this interruption is clear.
\pop[2]The static clears, and the silhouette of somebody appears.
\pop[2]It's impossible to tell who they are.
\pop[2]Any discerning characteristics are impossible to see.
\pop[2]They start to speak, their voice clearly altered, as everyone watches in awe.
I am the one known as \c[10]Hermes\c[0].
\pop[5]Do not be alarmed. I've come to deliver a message to the \c[23]Argus Corporation\c[0].
For over a century now, they have taken advantage of \c[17]Komorebi\c[0].
\pop[5]In doing so, they have created a world that can't exist without them.
Or at the very least, an illusion of such a world. A mere facade.
\pop[5]The very existence of \c[10]zeros\c[0] proves that life without \c[23]Argus\c[0] is possible.
But they detest this fact, seeking to expand and overtake the colonies.
\pop[5]They do their best to keep \c[10]zeros\c[0] from entering the city.
But they also do their best to stop \c[14]you\c[0] from leaving, with harsh repercussions.
\pop[5]They threaten to condemn your entire bloodline to a life without them.
Like this society they maintain is some sort of blessing, or paradise.
\pop[5]But \c[10]Cipher\c[0] believes in unity of the people.
The freedom to come and go. To choose the life you live.
\pop[5]The \c[10]zeros\c[0] you see in the town square are simply the first to choose.
They wish to live in harmony, and denounce this ostracism.
\pop[5]But they get weaker and weaker, as \c[23]Argus\c[0] refuses to act.
Initially, our demands had a generic timeframe, instead of a deadline.
\pop[5]We believed that this would be a test, to see if \c[23]Argus\c[0] valued the sanctity of life.
No matter the timeframe - the faster they acted, the more they cherished lives.
\pop[5]So look to the town square. Those once hopeful, now desparate and starving.
A testament to \c[23]Argus\c[0]' lack of care. The truth on full display.
\pop[5]It's clear that they wish to ignore our ultimatum.
That is why we rescind it, and exchange it with action.
On Sunday, the fifth of January, a \c[14]new\c[0] era begins.
\pop[5]We will provide all \c[10]zeros\c[0] in the town square with access to \c[23]The System\c[0].
Our work is undetectable, and we invite \c[23]Argus\c[0] to put that to the test.
\pop[5]This is also a call to action for anybody who supports our cause.
We've seen the polls online. But it's time to take action in person.
\pop[5]The \c[10]zeros\c[0] might not make it to that deadline without food.
Please, gather together, and offer charity to those in need.
\pop[5]And on the fifth? Everyone gather in the town square.
When our work is done, everybody will be holding phones.
\pop[5]It will be impossible to tell who is a \c[10]zero\c[0], and who is not.
This is a sight that I think everybody, especially \c[23]Argus\c[0] needs to see.
\pop[5]I request, no, implore that you attend.
It is time for you to see that your rule is over.
\pop[5]New citizens, new jobs, access to travel without hindrance...
The only one who stands to lose, is you, and your monopoly.
\pop[5]And so I will leave you all with one final message...
\pop[5]The world should be in the hands of those who are willing to change it every single day.
Not those who've changed it once, and refuse to let go of their possession.
\pop[2]The static returns for a moment, and then the TV's return to normal programming.
\pop[2]Well then. That made things a lot more clear.
But right now, they're just a bunch of talk.
\pop[2]The feeling in the room is really weird.
\pop[2]It's almost like everyone is in denial of what they just saw.
\pop[2]A rebel organization hijacked all the TV's in Toronto?
\pop[2]Until now, only \c[23]Argus\c[0] ever had the power to do that.
\pop[2]Just like the anniversary report, they used it to push their own agenda.
\pop[2]Everything feels different now. Almost like a battlefield became active.
\pop[2]If anything made \c[23]Argus\c[0] take action, this would be it.
\pop[2]And that could blow up in our faces, quite significantly...
\pop[4]Gotta say, I kinda like what I heard.
Everyone feeding my friends in the town square?
Then gathering together on the fifth to help trick \c[23]Argus\c[0]?
\pop[3]Well, when the dust settles, everyone there will have phones.
They wouldn't know who to arrest. It's genius, actually.
\pop[4]Only if people actually show up, though.
\pop[3]I guess we just need to have some faith.
\pop[2]We all shrug, and everyone takes out their phones.
\pop[2]Social media was sure to be abuzz with posts about what just happened.
\pop[2]Maybe if this works out in Toronto, then other cities could follow suit...
\pop[2]In the right hands, \c[10]Hermes\c[0]' blueprint could cause irrevocable change.
\pop[2]It really did feel like we were approaching a new "era".
\pop[2]Taylor blushes and rubs the back of his head.
\pop[4]You still wanting me to go pick up those snacks?
